    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyValueFlattener

        public KeyValueFlattener(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers,
                 PersistenceRenderer arrayRenderer,
                 java.lang.String keySeparator)
        Constructs a basic key-value flattener that uses the specified renderers and separator.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping between the Class represented by an InfoNode and the PersistenceRenderer used to create the key-value pair.
        arrayRenderer - The PersistenceRenderer used to create key-value pairs for InfoNodes that represent an array.
        keySeparator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key
        See Also:
        AbstractKeyValueBuilder.getRenderer(Class)

      • KeyValueFlattener

        public KeyValueFlattener(java.lang.String keySeparator)
        Constructs a basic key-value flattener that uses the default renderers and specified separator.
        Parameters:
        keySeparator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key

        Constructs a key-value flattener using the specified key-value list builder
        Parameters:
        builder - The KeyValueBuilder used to flatten the semantic model

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyElementSeparator

        public void setKeyElementSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator

      • getKeyElementSeparator

        public java.lang.String getKeyElementSeparator()
        Returns:
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.

      • setBuilder

        public void setBuilder(KeyValueBuilder builder)
        Sets the builder responsible for creating the key-value pairs from the semantic model, and that is responsible for parsing the key-value pairs into a semantic model.
        Parameters:
        builder - the KeyValueBuilder responsible for creating the key-value pairs from the semantic model, and that is responsible for parsing the key-value pairs into a semantic model.

      • getBuilder

        public KeyValueBuilder getBuilder()
        Returns:
        the KeyValueBuilder responsible for creating the key-value pairs from the semantic model, and that is responsible for parsing the key-value pairs into a semantic model.

      • buildKeyValuePairs

        public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode root)

      • setShowFullKey

        public void setShowFullKey(boolean isShowFullKey)
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String. I recommend against setting this to true.
        Parameters:
        isShowFullKey - true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default

      • isShowFullKey

        public boolean isShowFullKey()
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String
        Returns:
        true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default
